page.title: 09THE QUEEN'S REGIMENT
page.content: A Soldier's Day Close to the Geoffrey Chaucer School is the HQ.of the Queen's Regiment. We interviewed soldiers from this regiment in order to discover what life was like for those who lived and worked here. The aspect of a soldier's career that takes up most of his working day is training. This starts after breakfast at 8.00am and continues until early evening . Fitness and skills are monitored by a physical training instructor who gradually builds up the training schedule. Some experienced soldiers might run 10-20 miles per day. When training a soldier could carry up to 35lbs of equipment. On occasions this weight might be increased to as much as 120lbs to simulate conditions during the Falklands crisis.
